intro: Cyrtandra callicarpifolia, commonly known as the red-flowered cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking red or orange tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous shrub with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in native forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
